info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 8:54AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN WARREN, SOUTHWESTERN GREENE AND MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 930 AM EDT... At 854 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Carlisle, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Kettering, Beavercreek, Huber Heights, Fairborn, Xenia, Trotwood, Miamisburg, Springboro, Vandalia, Englewood, Franklin, Bellbrook, Moraine, Carlisle, Oakwood, Wright-Patterson Afb, West Carrollton, Hunter and Riverside. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
